alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 13 at 9:58PM EDT until March 14 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches along the western facing slopes. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph could result in areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...In Maryland, Extreme Western Allegany County. In West Virginia, Western Mineral County. * WHEN...Until 9 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The most widespread snow is most likely between 3 AM overnight and 8 AM Tuesday morning. Visibility may be reduced below one mile at times in snow and areas of blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
